entries.title: President Trump doubled-down on his view that Republicans should “nationalize” voting in the U.S.
Stephen Miller called Alex Pretti a “domestic terrorist” after the VA nurse was killed by federal agents, a rare misstep for Miller, the White House aide stoking Trump’s boundary-pushing impulses.
An ex-Fed official is found not guilty of conspiring to share confidential central bank information with China, capping a case that featured spycraft, online seduction and a blackmail scam
Iranian provocations against the U.S. Tuesday raised questions as to whether nuclear talks between Tehran and Washington would go ahead. But the talks are still expected this week, U.S. officials say
The Republican-led House passed funding legislation to end a partial government shutdown—and Trump signed it—kicking off 10 days of negotiations over immigration enforcement
Bill and Hillary Clinton reached a deal to appear for depositions in the House investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, avoiding a contempt-of-Congress vote
President Trump shared a rendering Tuesday of the facade of the future East Wing and ballroom, saying it would be the same height and scale as the main part of the White House
A federal judge blocked the Trump administration from revoking immigration protections for hundreds of thousands of Haitians, allowing them to remain in the U.S. legally
The Trump administration says its crackdown on immigration is reducing housing prices. Economists say other factors such as oversupply matter more
A poll shows 76% of Greenlanders say they wouldn’t benefit from becoming part of the U.S., wary of trading Denmark’s welfare system for U.S. healthcare, elder care and education
Bill and Hillary Clinton made a new offer to give depositions for a House committee’s investigation of Epstein, days ahead of an expected vote on contempt of Congress for the Democratic power couple
Five reasons Republicans are worried about this Texas state Senate race
A state-level Democratic win in a region that had voted decisively for President Trump threatens to diminish Republicans’ hopes for the midterm elections
Shifting views on the president’s immigration agenda threaten to turn one of his signature issues into a liability for Republicans in the coming midterm elections
Tulsi Gabbard has been investigating results of the 2020 election that President Trump lost, and earlier this week joined the FBI search of an election center in Georgia
Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota announced she will run for state governor after Gov. Tim Walz said earlier this month that he would not seek a third term
U.S. weapons makers are fighting a battle on two fronts: ensuring strong returns for investors and trying to satisfy their biggest customer—the Pentagon
A cloak-and-dagger mystery reminiscent of a John le Carré novel is swirling around a whistleblower complaint that alleges wrongdoing by U.S. spy chief Tulsi Gabbard
The Trump administration approved $15.7 billion of proposed arms sales to Saudi Arabia and Israel, according to the Pentagon
Trump is fast approaching a decision on whether to agree to a Russian proposal to extend limits on long-range nuclear weapons for another year or do nothing when the treaty expires
Lockheed Martin to Quadruple Thaad Missile-Defense Output
